SecuGen.FDxSDKPro

Class SGAutoOnEventNotifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • SecuGen.FDxSDKPro.SGAutoOnEventNotifier

  • public class SGAutoOnEventNotifier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class checks the status of the attached SecuGen fingerprint sensor to determine if a finger is present. When a finger is detected, the SGFingerPresentCallback() method implemented by the host application is called.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SGAutoOnEventNotifier(JSGFPLib sgfplib, SGFingerPresentEvent event)
      Create a new instance of SGAutoOnEventNotifier.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • SGAutoOnEventNotifier

        public SGAutoOnEventNotifier(JSGFPLib sgfplib,
                     SGFingerPresentEvent event)
        Create a new instance of SGAutoOnEventNotifier. Also calls open() method to initialize the native library.
        Parameters:
        sgfplib - A fully initialized JSGFPLib object. OpenDevice() must be called before passing the JSGFPLib object as a parameter to this constructor.
        event - The host Android application that implements the SGFingerPresentEvent interface. This application must have a method named SGFingerPresentCallback().
        See Also:
        JSGFPLib, JSGFPLib.OpenDevice(long), SGFingerPresentEvent

      • start

        public long start()
        Start the SGAutoOnEventNotifier finger detection thread.
        Returns:
          ♦ SGFDxErrorCode.ERROR_NONE on success.

      • stop

        public long stop()
        Stop the SGAutoOnEventNotifier finger detection thread.
        Returns:
          ♦ SGFDxErrorCode.ERROR_NONE on success.
